TopicTitle: Multi-Layer Insulation Blankets: a Skin for FusTek Station Parts

Articles.Content:
[![zbjkNOZ.png](http://i.imgur.com/zbjkNOZ.png)](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/641/Multi-Layer%20Insulation%20Blankets)

![tHdyXvR.png](http://i.imgur.com/tHdyXvR.png)

![kO6sfGn.png](http://i.imgur.com/kO6sfGn.png)

[**Download from KerbalStuff**](http://kerbalstuff.com/mod/641/Multi-Layer%20Insulation%20Blankets)

v1.0 Initial Release

Dependencies

- FusTek Station Parts WIP builds X0.04-4, as this is only an additional skin for the FusTek Station Parts

- Firespitter plugin

- ModuleManager plugin (sarbian)

Recommended Mods

- ActiveTextureManagement

Installation

1. Ensure that you have all of the aforementioned dependencies installed

2. Remove any previous version of this Mod

3. Extract and move the FusTek\_Retexture Folder to your GameData Folder: <ksp>/GameData/FusTek_Retexture</ksp>

Usage

Right-click on any of the FusTek Station Parts and use the Buttons labelled "Next Style" to choose the MLI Blankets Textures

License

This work is now shared under Creative Commons CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license.

Acknowledgements

Robin "sumghai" Chang and Alex "fusty" Sterling (author and original author, FusTek Station Parts)

Nothke (inspiration by his textures for older FusTek builds)

If you're interested, I can give you access to the main FusTek repo on GitHub, so that you can add your alternative textures in for official inclusion. Give me a shout via PM and we'll figure it out from there.

I'm having an issue where the textures for the hatches on the ends aren't displaying correctly. This is with a fresh install of Fustek X0.04-4 with all the correct dependencies. ![1mQoJT7.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/1mQoJT7.jpg?1)

Okay, I know exactly what the problem is.

You need to download the experimental version of FusTek Station Parts [directly from the GitHub repo](https://github.com/sumghai/FusTek_StationParts), because I changed the UV mapping on several parts. 

I haven't packaged a new official release because I haven't finished making IVAs yet, like I promised years ago.

> 
> Okay, I know exactly what the problem is.
> You need to download the experimental version of FusTek Station Parts [directly from the GitHub repo](https://github.com/sumghai/FusTek_StationParts), because I changed the UV mapping on several parts.

Worked like a charm! Thanks, sumghai! 

**edit**

Looks like some issues have manifested with the latest version from Github, but not with this texture pack specifically. [I've detailed them in this post.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/35043-0-24-x-0-25-0-PAUSED-FusTek-Station-Parts-%28WIP-builds-on-GitHub%29?p=1792176&viewfull=1#post1792176)

Thanks fpr the feedback!

My thoughts where that the gold foiled parts are rather "internal" parts. Therefore I applied them on the parts that are (at least can be) covered up by other parts. Like the small or big berthing adapters or the tapered adapter/end plate that is in the pack. This way you can have four different styles: plain gold foil that looks a bit like there is something to be added later, the big berthing node or the tapered, mli-covered adapter plate, with or without the small berthing adapter.

I love these textures, and wonder if you would consider making them work with the [Stockalike Station Parts Expansion](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91814-1-02-Stockalike-Station-Parts-Expansion-%2804-05-2015-CTT-and-minor-fixes%29) mod?
